definition: to lend/to borrow/by means of/to take (an opportunity)

sentences.english: Rather than borrow, he went without food.
sentences.chinese: 他宁肯不吃，也不愿借债。

sentences.english: It was unwise of you to get into debt.
A writ allowing a creditor to assume temporary ownership of a debtor's property.
sentences.chinese: 令许可债权人临时占有借债人的财产的一种书面命令。

sentences.english: The lender has a better memory than the borrower.
Number one is that we got a -- we had a system in which there was huge amounts of leverage that banks could take.
sentences.chinese: 第一是我们有一个体系，银行可在从中取得巨额借债。

sentences.english: He that goes a borrowing, goes a sorrowing .
It’s not like an overdrawn bank account which can be made up later.
sentences.chinese: 这不象银行借债，以后可还。

sentences.english: And yet during that period, America's borrowing costs have fallen.
sentences.chinese: 但是，在那一段时间内，美国的借债成本却是下降的。

sentences.english: He that goes a borrowing, goes a sorrowing.
The fellows having the land or extending loan to others are the loser.
sentences.chinese: 有土地或者借债给别人的人就是输家。

sentences.english: Now suddenly Americans can't borrow in order to spend.
sentences.chinese: 然后突然之间美国人不能借债消费了。

sentences.english: A debt was, to him, the beginning of slavery.
sentences.chinese: 他感到借债便是奴役的开始。

sentences.english: The first is the borrower's ability to repay the loan and the second is the market value of the property.
sentences.chinese: 首先是借债人了偿贷款的能力，其次是财富的市值。

sentences.english: The borrowers may use cash or deposits with the Bank of China for debt service.
sentences.chinese: 借债人可用现金或其在中国银行的存款了偿贷课本息。

definition: to raise a loan/to borrow money
lit. build a high desk of debt (idiom); heavily in debt
to owe a debt/the sum owed
to be in debt/to incur debts/liability (finance)
lit. pull down the east wall to repair the west wall (idiom); fig. temporary expedient/rob Peter to pay Paul
pinyin: chai1 dong1 qiang2 bu3 xi1 qiang2

definition: to borrow or lend money/debit and credit items on a balance sheet
to press for payment of debts/to dun
